question: Incubation period of scabies is:
exp: Scabies - Causative agent: Sarcoptes Scabies Var Hominis Incubation Period: 3-4 weeks after the infection is acquired. If pt. reinfested- ICP is 2 days

question: A child has multiple itchy papular lesions on genitalia and fingers. Similar lesions are also noted in his younger brother. What is the diagnosis?
exp: The four cardinal features suggestive of scabies 1 Presence of burrow in S. Corneum especially on the hand or penis 2 Characteristic distribution of lesions: Face, palm, soles involved in infants but spared in adults. Circle of Hebra: Web spaces, groins, periumblical area and flexors of wrist, elbow & axilla. 3 History of similar illness in other family members 4 Intense pruritus (nocturnal)

question: Drug of choice in scabies in pregnant woman is -
exp: Topical Permethrin 5% lotion is DOC in scabies in pregnant woman. MOA of Permethrin: Acts on Na channels. Crotamiton 10% and Precipitated sulphur can also be used Gamma Benzene Hexachloride: C/I in pregnancy. Ivermectin: Systemic agent used only in most severe scabies. Benzyl benzoate: disadvantage is multiple application is required.

question: Disorder of hyperkeratinization?
exp: Hyperkeratinization: Icthyosis vulgaris Vitiligo is hypopigmentry disorder. Atopic dermatitis: itchy lichenified lesions over flexors of elbow and knee Seborrheic dermatitis: scaly lesion Icthyosis vulgaris: AD disorder Reduced or absence of filaggrin protein and granular layer Fish-like scales on the skin.

question: Nodular scabies is found in:
exp: Scabies Mostly involves: web spaces, flexors of wrist, elbow & axilla. Infants: Scalp, face, neck, palms and soles. Nodular Scabies: scrotum Norwegian Scabies: severe, whole body involved, seen in malnourished and immunocompromised. Scabies incognito: wrongly treated with steroids.

question: Creeping cutaneous eruption is most commonly due to:
exp: Hook Worm (Ankylostoma duodenale) Poal of entry- skin Adult worm in small intestine of man (the only definitive host). Eggs floats in saturated solution of common salt It causes - Iron deficiency anemia Bronchitis and bronchopneumonia, Creeping eruptions (cutaneous larva migrans), Ground itch (Ancylostome dermatitis) 2-3 days later, serpiginous eruptions appear as the larvae migrate at a rate of several millimeters a day; It is also caused by: Ancyclostoma braziliense, Uncinaria stenocephala, Ancyclostoma caninum, Bunostobum phlebotomum, Strongyloids stercolaris, Necator americanus, etc.

question: A 10-year-old girl presents with scalp pruritus for several weeks. Nits are visible on her hair. Which of the following treatment recommendations would you recommend?
exp: Case of Pediculosis capitis - 1% permethrin lotion, apply to clean, dry hair for 10 minutes, re-treat in 1 week is t/t of choice. For pubic lice, the 5% permethrin lotion should be used
opa: 1% permethrin lotion, apply to clean, dry hair for 10 minutes, re-treat in 4 weeks
opb: 1% permethrin lotion, apply to wet hair for 10 minutes, re-treat in 4 weeks
opc: 1% permethrin lotion, apply to clean, dry hair for 10 minutes, re-treat in 1 week
opd: 1% permethrin lotion, apply to wet hair for 10 minutes, re-treat in 1 week

question: Vagabond disease is:
exp: Vagabond disease ( Pediculosis Corporis): in person affected by triad of: Inadequate food Low personal hygiene Heavy infestation of pediculi Usually show Addisonian pattern of pigmentation with involvement of mucous membrane. Exact pathogenesis of hyperpigementaion -not known but considered to be post inflammatory. Adrenal function is normal in most of the cases.

question: A 2-year-old born out of consanguineous marriage, had a history of the collodian membrane. He had large, thick, plate-like brown scaling generalized distribution; no erythroderma and ectropion. Which disease is it?
exp: Lamellar Ichthyosis(LI) Colloidion baby -the baby is covered by a thickened colloidion membrane. Scaling occurs over the whole body including creases and bends. Scale in LI - large, dark brown or grey and firmly adherent. Drooping of lower eyelids (ectropion), palmoplantar keratoderma & scarring alopecia seen in severe cases. ICHTHYOSIS VULGARIS X LINKED ICHTHYOSIS LAMELLAR ICHTHYOSIS AD XLR AR Def. of filaggrin Def. of steroid sulphatase enzyme Def. of transglutaminase-1 enzyme Extensors mainly involved Extensors and flexors involved Whole body involved-Colloidion membrane/ baby Netheon syndrome: Newborn have skin that is red and scaly (ichthyosiform erythroderma), and the skin may leak fluid.

question: In a child with itchy lesions over the groin and prepuce. Which of the following should not be advised?
exp: Child suffering from scabies: use scabicidal. Anti-scabetic agent applied to entire body sparing scalp and face. Preferably applied after a good scrub bath with soap and water. All the clothes worn should be washed, dried in hot sun & ironed. All the members if personal household and other intimates should be treated even if they do not have obvious symptoms or signs. Systemic antibiotics seldom required for mild secondary pyoderma seen in early stages of scabies. For severe pyoderma especially in debilitated patients a systemic antibiotic may be given.

question: 'Maculae cerulea' seen in:
exp: Pthisis pubis (pubic lice) - Seen on pubic hair Initial symptom - Itching Blue grey macules - the "maculae cerulae" Sexually transmitted infection. Diagnosis - Establishing the lice seen as yellow brown specks clinging closely to the base of hair. Rx-shaving of pubic hair Permethrin 2% application Treatment of contact

question: Norwegian scabies is most commonly seen in?
exp: Norwegian scabies: most severe type. Hyperkeratotic scaly and crusted lesions. Large number of mites but Pruritus is less. sites -scalp, face, palms, soles, neck, and lumbosacral area. old, bedridden patients, leprosy with decreased sensations & immunocompromised Rx: Patients with crusted scabies require 2 doses of IVERMECTIN (200 micro g/kg) separated by an interval of 1-2 weeks.

question: Chiclero's ulcer caused by:-
exp: Chiclero ulcer ( gum tree harvestor's ulcer) seen in leishmania Mexicana (New world) Leishmania C/B Cutaneous Mucocutaneous Visceral New world- L. Maxicana- chiclero ulcers (Gum tree harvestor's ulcer) Old world- L. Major- Delhi boils ulcers with central crusting Skin mucosa involved mutilation present: ESPUNDIA L. Donovani (PKDL) - Nodule (face) Hypopigmented (trunk) Past H/o fever Nerve thickening absent Endemic -Bihar

question: The burrows in scabies is in the -
exp: Scabies mite burrows into Stratum corneum. These are visible clinically as irregular grey-brown lines.

question: A 42-year-old Bengali male presents with painless nodules over the face. The face is erythematous, and the surface of some of the large nodules is discolored. He gives history of insect bite in past while he went to the jungle for work. What is the most likely diagnosis?
exp: H/o insect bite followed by the events leading to ulceration in a resident or traveller to an endemic focus strongly suggests cutaneous Leishmaniasis (CL). Post-Kala azar dermal Leishmaniasis: Hypopigmented lesions over trunk & Nodular lesions over face. Lymphocytes are the dominant cells. Demonstration of amastigotes in material obtained from a lesion remains the diagnostic gold standard.

question: Eye lash infestation by pediculosis is caused by:
exp: Lice: Head lice Body lice Pubic lice Pediculosis capitis Pediculosis corporis Phthiriasis pubis Phthriasis palpebrarum - -rare eyelid infestation -cause: Phthiriasis pubis
